Exploring the different qualities or expressions of Nibbāna, I was just comparing them with the Sinhalese language. I wonder whether there are similarities in Pāli. You said Nibindatti. _Bindinava_ means breaking up in Sinhalese. When you say Nibbāna, if you just use the second half, _bana_. To give an example of what _bana_ means, let’s say you have a truckload of things. Taking the things out, lowering them down and putting them down means _bana_. So the whole process is emptying out. I don't know how it is in Pali.
